properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Total snowfall: generally 2 to 4 cm with locally up to 10 cm in snow squalls. Maximum wind gusts: near 50 km/h. Locations: Iles-de-la-Madeleine, and northwestern Cape Breton. Time span: today. Remarks: Snow squalls and flurries will continue to taper off this afternoon. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-19T20:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-19T15:02:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1977233503.2020
Area: ÃŽles-de-la-Madeleine
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog will persist until later this morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-19T19:29:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-19T11:43:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3385927566.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds gusting up to 80 km/h today. Strong southwesterly winds with gusts up to 70 or 80 km/h are expected today. The strongest wind gusts will be near Lake Erie. These strong winds will continue into this evening before easing early tonight. These winds have the potential to toss loose objects and break tree branches. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-20T07:45:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-19T15:46:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4131611427.2020

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm continues. An area of snow is moving through central Alberta and will taper off through the day. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Total snowfall: locally 10 cm in snow squalls. Locations: southwestern Newfoundland. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: Flurries and snow squalls will continue throughout the day. The snow squalls will taper off this evening with flurries lingering throughout the night. Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-11-20T01:59:06-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm continues. An area of heavy snow moving through central Alberta will taper off through the day. The northern extent of the heavy snow is roughly along Highway 16. Over the city of Edmonton total snowfall amounts will vary with the highest amounts falling in the south, where near 10 cm is expected by this afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-20T03:19:38-00:00
